Author: amichail
Content: But of course, to avoid excessive promotion, we could have a limit of one update per week for each app.

Author: amichail
Title: Anyone interested in setting up a blog for web 2.0 app updates?  Pretty well any update would be accepted.

Author: jaggederest
Content:
Useless. Extrinsic motivation will never get someone to work productively for 80 hours a week.

After somewhere around 30-ish it's gotta be intrinsic desire-to-make-thing-better, not 'ooh I get paid more'\n

Author: gyro_robo
Content:
Not only can't YC pick every good team, but they have a bias towards certain types of start-ups: fairly simple websites (reddit, octopart, pollground, etc.).

CRV loans up to $250k which opens up a wider range of start-up possibilities. E.g. if you are working on something involving hardware; remember Apple really got moving with a $250k line of credit backed by Mike Markkula (consumer price index says $250k in 1977 is about $855k in 2006 dollars).\n

Author: gyro_robo
Content:
building a workplace that attracts and keeps great people is especially important now because the job market for skilled people is so hot.

I think it's kind of sad that it isn't seen as a worthy goal in itself, but indicated merely because of a hot job market. The implication is that you should treat people as poorly as you can get away with.

I think PG is right in that someday people will view jobs the same way we view serfdom.\n

Author: gyro_robo
Content:
That's effectively like a continuous deadline then: "Always Be Coding".

Deadlines are another form of advance planning, kind of a way to tell yourself to clear your schedule of distractions. I think it applies more to obligations you have trouble with dedicating time toward -- you don't really need to plan to do stuff you want to do :)\n

Author: SwellJoe
Content: Amateurs.  I could do it with a single Nintendo Wii.

Author: drudru
Content:
2 options

1. launch now\n2. start a blog about the event

nice-side-effect: get the rest of the world tuned into the idea and create a ton of competition in the space.\n

Author: Leonidas
Content:
Maybe the owners are disgruntled Y Rejects?

I don't quite understand why anyone would not want "free" press. The only thing I could think of is perhaps 'doing business' from the property might break a 'zoning' law of a sort.
